availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bailous Phelps (Caldwell County, KY, farmer and clergyman)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Mississippi native. Married to Mahony Jones Phelps in Caldwell County, Kentucky on July 20, 1826. Father of Louisa A. Phelps, Martha E. Phelps, Alzada G. Phelps, Laura B. Phelps, Sarah V. Phelps, and Charlie Phelps. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Baptist clergyman in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 348A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 79.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 221B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 14.
Find A Grave, "Bailous Phelps (1802-1870)," Memorial #89672594, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89672594 (accessed May 27, 2020).
